scaling.rationale: Exploration experiments showed StandardScaler provides optimal performance, and features have different scales (sepal width: 2.0-4.4 vs petal length: 1.1-6.9)

feature_engineering_steps.rationale: Exploration experiments demonstrated that original features achieve near-perfect performance (98.3% accuracy, 1.00 macro-AUC). Feature engineering provided minimal benefit and may introduce unnecessary complexity.

rejected_approaches.reason: Sepal/Petal ratios showed no improvement over original features
Sepal/Petal area approximations showed no improvement over original features

primary_algorithm.name: LinearDiscriminantAnalysis
primary_algorithm.rationale: LDA achieved perfect macro-AUC (1.00) in exploration experiments and is theoretically well-suited for this linearly separable multi-class problem. It provides probabilistic outputs needed for AUC calculation.

backup_algorithms.name: LogisticRegression
backup_algorithms.rationale: Achieved 99.8% macro-AUC in exploration, provides good interpretability

backup_algorithms.name: SVM
backup_algorithms.rationale: Achieved 97.5% accuracy and excellent macro-AUC in exploration

Visualize how well the model separates species in the transformed feature space
Analyze model confidence for correct vs incorrect predictions
Identify if any species (setosa, versicolor, virginica) has systematically lower performance
